title: Oura Ring 4 ‚Äî Health Tracking You'll Actually Wear
summary: A titanium ring that tracks sleep, heart rate, temperature, and activity ‚Äî without looking like a gadget.
content:
The Oura Ring 4 solves the biggest problem with wearable health trackers: nobody wants to wear a chunky smartwatch to bed. The ring is lightweight titanium, looks like jewelry, and lasts 7+ days on a single charge. You forget it's a health tracker, which is exactly why you actually wear it.

Sleep tracking is where Oura excels. It measures sleep stages, heart rate variability, blood oxygen, and skin temperature with clinical-grade accuracy. The morning Readiness Score tells you at a glance whether to push hard or take it easy ‚Äî it factors in sleep quality, recovery, and recent activity trends.

The new Gen 4 sensors improved daytime heart rate tracking significantly. Activity tracking counts steps and calories, but the real value is the long-term trends: see how your sleep responds to exercise, alcohol, late meals, or stress over weeks and months. The cycle tracking feature uses temperature shifts for accurate period predictions.
frictionNote: $349 + $6/month subscription required for full insights. Sizing kit recommended (free). No screen means you need your phone for details.
